title: Karen Matthews' neighbour kept diaries of prison chats with kidnap mum and shares message for Shannon in new Channel 5 documentary
text:
Karen Matthews' neighbour kept diaries of prison chats with kidnap mum and shares message for Shannon in new Channel 5 documentary A new Channel 5 documentary will explore the case that shocked the nation back in 2008 Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now New documentary looks deeper into the kidnap of Shannon Matthews Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Karen Matthews ’ neighbour Julie Bushby has revealed how she kept diaries of her chats with the kidnap mum to reveal whether her story ever changed and what she’d say to Shannon Matthews if she could speak with her today. 
The shocking abduction of Shannon by her own mother Karen will be explored in new Channel 5 documentary, Shannon Matthews: What Happened Next , airing Tuesday night. 
It follows the success of BBC One drama The Moorside, starring Sheridan Smith, which told the story of Shannon’s disappearance and Karen’s betrayal from the community’s point of view. Julie Bushby in the Channel 5 documentary (Photo: Channel 5) This was the image of Shannon used to publicise her disappearance in 2008 (Photo: PA) 
Sheridan played Karen’s neighbour Julie Bushby, who was a key figure in drumming up publicity and organising search parties after Shannon vanished on the way home from school at just nine years old. 
Julie is among those who contribute to Channel 5’s documentary. 
In an interview to be broadcast in the programme, Julie reveals how she kept notes after her meetings with Karen in prison, and claims that Karen’s story would frequently change. Karen made public appeals for the return of Shannon - despite knowing where the child was the whole time Karen was convicted alongside Michael Donovan, the uncle of her boyfriend Craig Meehan (Photo: Daily Mirror) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
“Her story changed each time. I kept a diary, and I would try to compare, you know, one visit… I kept a diary when I went to visit, and I were comparing what she’d told me that last visit, to this visit, and then, you know, and there was just nothing that I could connect,” says Julie. 
When asked if she thinks she’ll ever know the full truth, Julie replies: “I’m not holding my breath.” 
She later says if she spoke to Karen now, she’d still try to find out all the details of what happened: “I probably would still want answers off of her. I tried for four years, so I don’t rate my chances.” Julie no longer has contact with Karen, under the terms of Karen's release from prison (Photo: Channel 5) The documentary explores Shannon's kidnap (Photo: Channel 5) 
Shannon was found drugged and hidden in the base of a divan bed at the home of Michael Donovan, the uncle of Karen's boyfriend Craig Meehan. 
Karen and Donovan were sent to jail for eight years on charges of kidnap, false imprisonment and perverting the course of justice 
Julie's contact with Karen ended under the terms of her probation. Karen was released from prison in 2012. Donovan had already been released at that stage. 
In the documentary, Julie admits she has always wondered if there were more people involved in the crime than just Karen and Donovan. 
“I think others were involved. There’s got… others have got to be involved, because like I’ve said before, and I’ll say it again, Karen didn’t have the intelligence, and Donovan, from what the cops have said, he didn’t have the intelligence,” she says.
